comments.body: I say this constantly. I love cats a lot, but the meowing makes me crazy. The same few tones of meows played every 5 seconds it feels like. If they were silent I'd keep them in my house, they're adorable.
Here's a better idea, introduce seals but have polar bears prey on them like piglins do with hoglins.

polar bears are the worst mob in minecraft, my hardcore series was ended just because i was within 10 blocks of the cub and my boat backs up SO slow. i nearly cried becaust this is the 4th one i have lost

Mojang previously said it wouldn't add dangerous animals such as sharks, crocodiles, and lions because they would harm children, but that's a contradiction as polar bears are a dangerous animal in Minecraft. I thought, but with this idea, it is possible to eliminate that contradiction.
It would be cool if you could use leads to attach lightning rods to other lightning rods and it would transfer the redstone power. This may or may not be done with leads

Good idea but theres not much of a use for it in survival or creative because in survival theres not point in trying to get these rare mobs and in creative you can just summon these mobs with commands or summon a lightning bolt while standing in a mob.
I love this idea; not only will we get dogs but Minecraft creators will get more money! This will get more dog people to play minecraft!
I think this is a great idea that would really add some use and background to the Glow Squid.
I wouldn't have them actually fly in the air, but it would be cool if there was a mob that swims higher when it is about to rain.
Perhaps there is another thing that detects when it is about to rain. Plants could move, lightning rods could have an animation, etc
It doesn't make too much sense in my opinion but I'm voting anyway because squid uprising.
We already told you about that
Do mooblooms moo or bloom? Such questions...

I like the idea of an endermite turning into these as well as the fact that they are not naturally spawning, but I don't think the bug should be created with lightning, mainly because the only way to get lightning in the End is through the Channeling enchantment. Perhaps they have to be hit by a shulker bullet?

IRL, elytra are not the wings of beetles, just the hard part that covers their real wings. Because of this, the Enderbeetle should have the elytra open but then have 2D transparent wings pop out which flap rapidly which allow them to actually fly instead of just glide

As elytra are the hard coverings for wings, they should act like armor to the Enderbeetles, possibly making them impervious to arrows like shulkers when they are closed, but also making it so they can't fly or move at all. They can be hit with arrows when the elytra are open, but the elytra on their backs may also get damaged, rendering it useless
They could also be called Endbeetles or Endibles

People have been wanting elytra to be added on top of armor, but as it is a hard covering for wings it could be made to be a type of armor itself. It could make it so the players back is impervious to arrows when closed. Turtle Shells could also be placed on the chestplate to do the same

As endermites are like the end-version of silverfish, they could infest Shulkers and then transform their shell into the elytra. They could also leave the shulker shell as an empty shulker box and fly away, but I am not sure about that.

One idea I had was that you could shear the wings off of them making them unable to fly, but that seems a bit too easy to farm. More likely, I think they should just have a rare chance to drop them. Either way, they should always drop a damaged elytra.
yeah, I just forgot to mention that part (about the armour)  and also, I like the idea of getting hit by a shulker bullet, but I feel like that would kill it...

also, when the elytra are closed, it should still be able to charge at you, and it would only bounce off arrows that hit the elytra. also, if this sheilding mechanic is added, I feel like it's protection should extend to the player.
I forgot to mention in the post that the beetle has a chance to drop a piece of 'exoskeleton armour', which is between iron and diamond strength, but it has a high level of armour toughness.
phantom membranes can already repair elytra
407837935732 we want renewable elytra, meaning we can farm it in some way
I like the idea of the Ender Dragon being upgraded when respawned, but I don't like much after that. I would also only have it be upgraded once
Maybe it's a Hydra? It could have more heads the more it is respawned

Definitely would love this. I want them walking around in a "ghost" town I'm building. Skeleton shop keep would be so fun.

I own axolotls and breed them. You CANNOT put axolotls near tropical fish, cod, salmon, or puffers. all 4 are too large and would either eat the axolotl directly, or nibble at its gills causing it to suffocate. Especially not tropical fish. Axolotls are freshwater and like it around 50 degrees F, with moderate ph, and little light. I also owned discus, which closely resemble the tropical fish in minecraft despite being freshwater, and my grandfather owns angel fish and trigger fish which also resemble the minecraft fish. Discus need very acidic low ph (not sure about the angels and triggers on this one), both need high temperatures (discus like it around 80F), and the angels and triggers like lots of light and are obviously saltwater fish. Axolotls would die in these conditions if they stayed for too long, or try to morph like on land but die from stress as they are losing their morph genes. Baby axolotls can only eat very small creatures, and sadly the only ones readily available on the market are baby brine shrimp, as you can buy hatcheries. Baby axolotls love them however as they are small crustaceans. I feed my adult axolotls blood worms, black worms, and sometimes an earthworm as a nice treat. They love worms, small arthropods, mollusks, and small crustaceans as this post includes. Small fish can still be risky due to the gill thing. If you don't want to add another mob, I feed my axolotls salmon pellets so adding a new craftable food item might work but would be weird.
I like everything, but I do not think you should be able to tame them..

I'm thinking of more ideas for the Statlar, and I am thinking that they could be found in herds of up to 5 Statlars. I am also thinking that when they migrate across oceans, sea creatures circulate around the Statlars legs.

I love the idea of a large passive fantasy mob! What would it do? Taming it might be too powerful. What if it kicked undead mobs? That might be too intense, and iron golems do that anyway. Maybe they spawn in a special biome and have a special, magical drop? These seem like the kind of good, peaceful creature that you shouldn't kill. Maybe you can get a magical item by trading with it in a peaceful way. Maybe it trades like the piglins, but it can't see items on the ground, because they are too far, so you have to build up to it to trade it things. What would you trade it? Maybe shiny things, maybe magic things. I don't know. Ideas?

Not this because if this happens players will get shulker boxes without going to the end.

Steve garder
getting a trident and channeling is probably far more difficult then going to the end, perhaps not necessarily more difficult then defeating the enderdragon and finding a end city, but most certainly more difficult then simply reaching the end, they are likely comparable in difficultly and if you have a channeling trident before you reach the end you likely just have no interest in it, so I see no reason this couldn't be a path for such a player to gain shulker boxes

I Like This But It's Not Fair As It Does Not Make Any Sense. If This Happens They Will Levitate Us Up And That Will Become Harder And Also We Can Get Shulker Farm And Can Make Shulker Box Easily That Will Be Easier So If This Happens Then Minecraft Will Become Easy But Will Loose It's Popularity
Nah. They should completely rework the Dragon fight. Don't try to fix something that's broken by adding more HP to it.
Dragon Fire could create purple fire that teleports the player around instead of simply hurting them

Dragon Breath could be used to make a teleportation potion that gives players the same particle effect as Endermen. When a projectile (or possibly any attack) is about to hurt you it could teleport you out of the way. It could also make it so water teleports you away
